channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: React2Shell Flaw Now a Gateway for Ransomware Attacks
item.description:
Headline: React2Shell Flaw Now a Gateway for Ransomware Attacks

Summary:
The critical unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability known as React2Shell (CVE-2025-55182) is now being actively and widely exploited by multiple threat actors. Initially used for deploying cryptominers and backdoors, the attacks have escalated significantly. Microsoft reports hundreds of compromised machines across various organizations. Most alarmingly, security firm S-RM has confirmed an incident where the flaw was used as the initial access vector to deploy Weaxor ransomware, a likely rebrand of the Mallox family, in under a minute. This development marks a shift from opportunistic attacks to targeted, financially motivated cyber extortion, demonstrating the high-risk and tangible impact of this easily exploitable vulnerability on corporate networks.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Ransomware, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Active and widespread exploitation of the critical React2Shell vulnerability (CVE-2025-55182) has escalated to include ransomware deployment, with attackers using the flaw as an initial access vector.

Article Slug: react2shell-vulnerability-exploited-for-ransomware-deployment

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: China-Linked Hackers Exploit Critical Cisco Email Gateway Zero-Day
item.description:
Headline: China-Linked Hackers Exploit Critical Cisco Email Gateway Zero-Day

Summary:
Cisco has revealed that a China-affiliated advanced persistent threat (APT) group, tracked as UAT-9686, is actively exploiting a critical zero-day vulnerability in its email security products. The flaw, CVE-2025-20393, is a remote code execution vulnerability with a maximum CVSS score of 10.0, affecting Cisco Secure Email Gateway and Secure Email and Web Manager appliances. The attackers have been exploiting the flaw since late November 2025 to gain root-level access and have deployed persistence mechanisms on compromised devices. Due to active exploitation by a nation-state actor, CISA has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating immediate patching for federal agencies.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A China-linked APT group (UAT-9686) is actively exploiting a critical zero-day RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-20393) in Cisco Secure Email Gateway appliances. CISA has added it to the KEV list.

Article Slug: china-linked-apt-exploits-cisco-email-gateway-zero-day

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: HPE Issues Urgent Patch for 10.0 CVSS RCE Flaw in OneView
item.description:
Headline: HPE Issues Urgent Patch for 10.0 CVSS RCE Flaw in OneView

Summary:
Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has released an urgent security advisory for CVE-2025-37164, a critical vulnerability in its OneView infrastructure management software with a maximum CVSS score of 10.0. The flaw allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to achieve complete remote code execution on affected systems. HPE OneView versions 5.20 through 10.20 are impacted. Given that OneView serves as a central control plane for enterprise server, storage, and firmware management, a compromise could give an attacker control over vast segments of IT infrastructure. HPE is urging customers to upgrade to the patched version 11.0 or apply an emergency hotfix immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: HPE urges customers to patch a critical 10.0 CVSS vulnerability (CVE-2025-37164) in HPE OneView, which allows for unauthenticated remote code execution and potential full infrastructure takeover.

Article Slug: hpe-patches-critical-10-0-cvss-flaw-in-oneview-management-tool

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in WatchGuard Firewalls Puts Networks at Risk
item.description:
Headline: Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in WatchGuard Firewalls Puts Networks at Risk

Summary:
WatchGuard has issued an urgent advisory for customers to patch CVE-2025-14733, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in its Fireware OS that is confirmed to be under active exploitation. The flaw, an out-of-bounds write issue in the IKEv2 process, has a CVSS score of 9.3 and can be exploited by an unauthenticated remote attacker. The vulnerability affects Firebox firewalls with specific IKEv2 VPN configurations enabled. Given that firewalls are prime targets for initial access, immediate application of the provided security updates is crucial to protect network perimeters from compromise.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: WatchGuard urges customers to patch a critical, actively exploited RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-14733) in Fireware OS affecting Firebox firewalls with IKEv2 VPN configurations.

Article Slug: watchguard-warns-of-actively-exploited-critical-firewall-rce-flaw

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Chrome Zero-Day Under Active Attack, Allows Full System Takeover
item.description:
Headline: Chrome Zero-Day Under Active Attack, Allows Full System Takeover

Summary:
Pakistan's National Computer Emergency Response Team (NCERT) has issued a high-alert advisory for a critical zero-day vulnerability in Google Chrome that is being actively exploited. The flaw, with a CVSS score of 9.8, affects all desktop versions (Windows, macOS, Linux) and can be triggered simply by a user visiting a malicious website. Successful exploitation allows for remote code execution that can bypass the browser's sandbox, potentially leading to a full system compromise. Users are at risk of malware installation, data theft, and credential loss. All users are urged to update to the latest stable version of Chrome immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Malware

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A critical, actively exploited zero-day vulnerability (CVSS 9.8) in Google Chrome allows for remote code execution and full system compromise. Users are urged to update their browsers immediately.

Article Slug: actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-allows-full-system-takeover

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK Introduces Major New Cybersecurity Bill with Stricter Rules and Hefty Fines
item.description:
Headline: UK Introduces Major New Cybersecurity Bill with Stricter Rules and Hefty Fines

Summary:
The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, a landmark piece of legislation designed to significantly update the 2018 Network and Information Systems (NIS) Regulations. The new bill expands the scope of regulated organizations, mandating stricter cybersecurity duties for a wider segment of British industry. Key changes include a stringent 24-hour initial incident reporting deadline and a 72-hour full reporting requirement. Furthermore, the bill dramatically increases penalties for non-compliance, with potential fines reaching up to £17 million or 4% of global turnover, bringing the UK's regulatory framework more in line with the EU's NIS2 Directive.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The UK's new Cyber Security and Resilience Bill will replace the 2018 NIS Regulations, introducing a wider scope, stricter 24-hour incident reporting, and significantly higher fines for non-compliance.

Article Slug: uk-proposes-major-overhaul-of-cybersecurity-laws-with-new-bill

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: SoundCloud Data Breach Exposes 28 Million Users' Information
item.description:
Headline: SoundCloud Data Breach Exposes 28 Million Users' Information

Summary:
Music streaming service SoundCloud announced on December 18, 2025, that it suffered a data breach exposing the information of approximately 28 million users. The company discovered the incident after detecting unauthorized access to an internal dashboard. The compromised data includes user email addresses and public profile information. SoundCloud has confirmed that more sensitive data, such as passwords and financial details, were not accessed. The company has secured the affected systems and is warning users to be vigilant for phishing attacks that may result from the exposed email addresses.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Music streaming service SoundCloud has suffered a data breach exposing the email addresses and public profile information of 28 million users after an internal dashboard was compromised.

Article Slug: soundcloud-data-breach-exposes-data-of-28-million-users

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Industrial Ransomware Attacks Surge in Q3 2025, Manufacturing Sector Hit Hardest
item.description:
Headline: Industrial Ransomware Attacks Surge in Q3 2025, Manufacturing Sector Hit Hardest

Summary:
A new report from industrial cybersecurity firm Dragos reveals a significant surge in ransomware attacks targeting industrial organizations in the third quarter of 2025. The firm tracked 742 global incidents, an increase from 657 in the previous quarter. The manufacturing sector was the most heavily impacted, accounting for 72% of all attacks. North America was the most targeted region. The report identifies the Qilin ransomware group as the most prolific, responsible for 138 incidents alone. The rise in attacks highlights the growing threat to operational technology (OT) environments as attackers exploit IT/OT convergence to disrupt critical operations.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A Dragos report finds that ransomware attacks targeting industrial organizations rose sharply in Q3 2025, with the manufacturing sector and North America being the most affected. Qilin was the most active ransomware group.

Article Slug: industrial-ransomware-attacks-surged-in-q3-2025-dragos-reports

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Manufacturing Web Portals Are a Weak Link in Supply Chain Attacks
item.description:
Headline: Manufacturing Web Portals Are a Weak Link in Supply Chain Attacks

Summary:
A new report reveals that cybercriminals are increasingly targeting manufacturers through their public-facing web portals, such as supplier and customer forms, to execute supply chain attacks. Attackers are using bots and SQL injection to compromise these forms, which often run on legacy systems with weak security. The goal is to steal sensitive data, including credentials and intellectual property, or to gain a foothold to attack more heavily regulated downstream customers in defense, healthcare, and finance. A survey found that 85% of manufacturing firms experienced a security incident related to web forms, and 42% confirmed a resulting data breach.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new report shows how attackers are using bots and SQL injection to compromise manufacturers' web portals, turning them into a weak link for launching supply chain attacks against their customers.

Article Slug: manufacturers-targeted-in-supply-chain-attacks-via-web-portals

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 700Credit Breach Exposes SSNs and Personal Data of 5.8M Consumers
item.description:
Headline: 700Credit Breach Exposes SSNs and Personal Data of 5.8M Consumers

Summary:
700Credit, a major technology provider for the U.S. auto finance industry, has revealed a data breach that exposed the highly sensitive personal information of nearly 5.8 million consumers. The incident, discovered in October 2025, involved an unauthorized party gaining access to the company's 700Dealer.com platform. The compromised data includes full names, mailing addresses, dates of birth, and Social Security numbers. This breach places millions of individuals at significant risk of identity theft and financial fraud, highlighting the severe downstream risks associated with vendor security in the financial services ecosystem.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Auto finance tech provider 700Credit has suffered a major data breach exposing the Social Security numbers and other sensitive personal data of nearly 5.8 million U.S. consumers.

Article Slug: 700credit-breach-exposes-sensitive-data-of-5-8-million-consumers

Published Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 19 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Zero-Day in Final 2025 Update
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Zero-Day in Final 2025 Update

Summary:
Microsoft's December 2025 Patch Tuesday addresses 57 vulnerabilities, including three zero-days. The most critical, CVE-2025-62221, is a privilege escalation flaw in the Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver that is being actively exploited in the wild. This has prompted the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to add it to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating a patch by December 30, 2025. The flaw allows a local, authenticated attacker to gain SYSTEM-level privileges. The update also patches other critical RCE flaws in Microsoft Office and publicly disclosed, but not exploited, bugs in PowerShell and GitHub Copilot.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability, Security Operations

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Microsoft's December 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes an actively exploited zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-62221) in the Windows Cloud Files Mini Filter Driver, along with 56 other flaws.

Article Slug: microsoft-patches-actively-exploited-windows-zero-day-in-december-2025-update

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Phishing Surge Hits Microsoft 365 via OAuth Device Code Abuse
item.description:
Headline: Phishing Surge Hits Microsoft 365 via OAuth Device Code Abuse

Summary:
Security researchers report a significant rise in phishing campaigns abusing the Microsoft OAuth 2.0 device authorization grant to compromise Microsoft 365 accounts. Both state-aligned groups like UNK_AcademicFlare and financially motivated actors like TA2723 are using this 'device code' phishing technique, often facilitated by Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS) kits like SquarePhish2. The attacks trick users into entering a short device code on Microsoft's legitimate 'microsoft.com/devicelogin' page, which inadvertently grants the attacker's malicious application a valid access token and persistent access to the victim's account.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Threat actors are increasingly abusing the Microsoft OAuth device code flow in sophisticated phishing campaigns to gain unauthorized access to Microsoft 365 accounts.

Article Slug: threat-actors-abuse-oauth-device-code-flow-in-microsoft-365-phishing-surge

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "GhostPoster" Malware Infects 50,000+ Firefox Users via Malicious Add-ons
item.description:
Headline: "GhostPoster" Malware Infects 50,000+ Firefox Users via Malicious Add-ons

Summary:
A stealthy malware campaign named "GhostPoster" has infected over 50,000 Mozilla Firefox users by distributing 17 malicious browser extensions. The add-ons, which masqueraded as legitimate tools like VPNs and ad blockers, have been removed from the Firefox store. The malware employed a clever technique, hiding obfuscated JavaScript within the add-on's logo image file. This code would then contact command-and-control (C2) servers to download a final payload designed for hijacking affiliate links and committing ad fraud. The campaign used evasion techniques like randomized and delayed C2 callbacks to avoid detection.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The GhostPoster malware campaign has infected over 50,000 Mozilla Firefox users by hiding malicious JavaScript inside the logo files of 17 browser extensions.

Article Slug: ghostposter-malware-infects-50000-firefox-users-via-malicious-add-ons

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "Scripted Sparrow" BEC Group Targets Finance Teams with Highly Structured Attacks
item.description:
Headline: "Scripted Sparrow" BEC Group Targets Finance Teams with Highly Structured Attacks

Summary:
A disciplined and persistent Business Email Compromise (BEC) group, newly identified by Fortra as "Scripted Sparrow," has been systematically targeting corporate finance teams since at least June 2024. The group employs a structured and well-researched approach, sending highly credible phishing emails with fake invoices that impersonate professional services firms. To add legitimacy, the attackers often include forged prior email correspondence from a company executive authorizing the payment. The group utilizes a large network of US-based mule accounts for cashing out, indicating a well-organized and persistent financial threat.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A persistent and organized Business Email Compromise (BEC) group named Scripted Sparrow is targeting finance teams with convincing phishing emails and fake invoices.

Article Slug: scripted-sparrow-bec-group-targets-finance-teams-with-disciplined-phishing-attacks

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "IRLeaks" Supply Chain Attack Hits Iranian Banks, Exposing Millions of Customer Records
item.description:
Headline: "IRLeaks" Supply Chain Attack Hits Iranian Banks, Exposing Millions of Customer Records

Summary:
A major supply chain attack dubbed "IRLeaks" has resulted in a significant data breach affecting several prominent Iranian banks and millions of their customers. Attackers first compromised a third-party IT vendor in October 2025, using it as a pivot point to infiltrate the banks' networks. Over the following month, they exfiltrated vast amounts of financial data and personally identifiable information (PII), including national IDs and bank account numbers, before the breach was discovered in late November. The incident highlights the critical risks associated with third-party vendor security and inadequate patch management.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The "IRLeaks" data breach exposed millions of Iranian bank customers' data after attackers compromised a third-party IT service provider, highlighting significant supply chain risks.

Article Slug: irleaks-breach-at-iranian-banks-exposes-millions-via-third-party-vendor

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Cloud Security Failing to Keep Pace with AI and Multicloud, Report Warns
item.description:
Headline: Cloud Security Failing to Keep Pace with AI and Multicloud, Report Warns

Summary:
A new report from Palo Alto Networks finds that cloud security operations are struggling to keep up with the rapid pace of multicloud adoption and AI integration. Attackers can now compromise cloud environments in minutes, while defenders take weeks to remediate critical issues. The report, which surveyed over 2,800 executives, highlights that identity and APIs are the top risk vectors, with 99% of organizations reporting at least one attack on their AI systems in the past year. It calls for a shift from fragmented security tools to integrated platforms to address the exponentially expanding attack surface.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: A Palo Alto Networks report reveals that cloud security is lagging behind the rapid expansion driven by AI and multicloud adoption, with attackers compromising environments in minutes.

Article Slug: cloud-security-failing-to-keep-pace-with-ai-and-multicloud-expansion

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Evolves: "ClickFix" Social Engineering and Threat Actor Alliances on the Rise
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Evolves: "ClickFix" Social Engineering and Threat Actor Alliances on the Rise

Summary:
A December 2025 threat report from NCC Group indicates that while ransomware attack volumes plateaued in November with 583 incidents, their sophistication markedly increased. Attackers are increasingly adopting the "ClickFix" (also known as ClearFake) social engineering technique, which tricks users into manually running malicious commands, bypassing many automated defenses. The report also highlights a trend of collaboration, with groups like DragonForce forming alliances with skilled affiliates from other networks. The Qilin ransomware group remained the most prolific actor, with the industrials sector and North America being the most targeted.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: Ransomware tactics are evolving with the rise of the "ClickFix" social engineering technique and increased collaboration between threat groups like Qilin and DragonForce, according to a new report.

Article Slug: ransomware-tactics-evolve-in-2025-with-focus-on-human-operated-attacks

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: AI-Powered Ransomware "PromptLock" and Petya Successor "HybridPetya" Emerge
item.description:
Headline: AI-Powered Ransomware "PromptLock" and Petya Successor "HybridPetya" Emerge

Summary:
ESET's H2 2025 threat report confirms the shift of AI-powered malware from theory to reality with the discovery of "PromptLock," the first known AI-driven ransomware capable of generating malicious scripts on the fly. The report also details the emergence of "HybridPetya," a modern successor to the destructive Petya/NotPetya wiper that is now capable of compromising UEFI-based systems. Other key trends from the second half of 2025 include the dominance of the Akira and Qilin RaaS operations and a massive surge in the CloudEyE (GuLoader) malware downloader, which saw its detections increase almost thirtyfold.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Ransomware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: ESET's H2 2025 threat report details the emergence of AI-powered ransomware "PromptLock," a new Petya variant "HybridPetya," and the dominance of the Akira and Qilin RaaS groups.

Article Slug: ai-powered-malware-and-petya-successor-emerge-in-h2-2025-threat-landscape

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: "Operation ForumTroll" APT Targets Russian Academics with Plagiarism Lure
item.description:
Headline: "Operation ForumTroll" APT Targets Russian Academics with Plagiarism Lure

Summary:
The Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group known as Operation ForumTroll has launched a new, highly targeted phishing campaign aimed at Russian political scientists and academics. Active since at least 2022, the group's latest attack uses meticulously crafted emails impersonating a major Russian scientific library, eLibrary.ru. The emails lure victims into downloading a supposed plagiarism report, which is a ZIP archive containing a malicious .LNK file. Executing the shortcut file triggers a PowerShell script that downloads and installs the Tuoni command-and-control (C2) framework, giving the attackers remote access for espionage purposes.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: The APT group Operation ForumTroll is targeting Russian academics with a new phishing campaign that uses fake plagiarism reports to deploy the Tuoni C2 framework.

Article Slug: operation-forumtroll-apt-targets-russian-academics-with-new-phishing-campaign

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Investigates Malicious Code Found in Search Result Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: Google Investigates Malicious Code Found in Search Result Infrastructure

Summary:
Google has launched an urgent investigation after cybersecurity analysts discovered anomalous, encrypted code snippets and obfuscated JavaScript embedded within its core search result payloads on December 17, 2025. The malicious code appears designed to exploit browser sandboxing vulnerabilities, which could potentially enable remote code execution or data theft on users' systems. While Google has not confirmed any user impact and states it is neutralizing the threat, the incident represents a highly sophisticated attack against critical global internet infrastructure, prompting the involvement of government agencies.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Google is investigating a potential security breach after malicious code and suspicious scripts were found embedded within its core search result infrastructure.

Article Slug: google-investigates-malicious-code-anomaly-in-search-results-infrastructure

Published Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: SANS Report: OT/ICS Cyber Incidents Rising, 40% Cause Downtime
item.description:
Headline: SANS Report: OT/ICS Cyber Incidents Rising, 40% Cause Downtime

Summary:
A new report from the SANS Institute highlights a dangerous trend in the security of Operational Technology (OT) and Industrial Control Systems (ICS). The '2025 State of ICS/OT Security Report' found that over 21% of organizations experienced a cyber incident in their OT environment in the past year. Of those, 40.3% suffered operational downtime. Ransomware was a primary cause, responsible for 37.9% of incidents, with unauthorized external connections being the top initial access vector. The report also points to a significant 'resilience gap,' with recovery times often exceeding one month.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The 2025 SANS State of ICS/OT Security Report finds that over 21% of organizations faced an OT cyber incident, with 40% suffering downtime, largely driven by ransomware and insecure remote access.

Article Slug: sans-report-shows-rising-ot-ics-cyber-incidents-driven-by-ransomware

Published Date: Fri, 21 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 21 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: 2025: The Year Cybersecurity 'Crossed the AI Rubicon'
item.description:
Headline: 2025: The Year Cybersecurity 'Crossed the AI Rubicon'

Summary:
According to analysis published on December 14, 2025, the year 2025 represents a fundamental and irreversible turning point for the cybersecurity industry. The widespread integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) into both offensive and defensive strategies has permanently altered the threat landscape. Key trends include the rise of 'agentic AI' capable of autonomous attacks, adaptive threats that change tactics in real-time, and a surge in highly convincing, AI-generated phishing and deepfake content. While defenders are also adopting AI, the 'great acceleration' in threat complexity is forcing a complete rethink of security playbooks.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Other

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: A 2025 year-in-review analysis concludes that the integration of artificial intelligence into both cyberattacks and defense strategies has permanently altered the threat landscape.

Article Slug: 2025-the-year-ai-redefines-cyberattacks-and-defense

Published Date: Sun, 14 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 14 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: SoundCloud and Pornhub Confirm User Data Exposure in Separate Breaches, One Via Third-Party
item.description:
Headline: SoundCloud and Pornhub Confirm User Data Exposure in Separate Breaches, One Via Third-Party

Summary:
Both SoundCloud and Pornhub have confirmed security incidents exposing user data. SoundCloud suffered a direct breach of an ancillary service dashboard, resulting in the exfiltration of email addresses and public profile information for up to 28 million users (20% of its user base). The company states passwords and financial data were not affected. Separately, Pornhub announced that historical analytics data of some Premium members was exposed due to a breach at its former third-party analytics vendor, Mixpanel. The notorious hacking group ShinyHunters has claimed the Mixpanel breach and is attempting to extort Pornhub, alleging they stole a massive database of user search and watch history.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: SoundCloud and Pornhub have disclosed separate data breaches. SoundCloud's breach exposed user emails, while Pornhub's data was leaked via a compromise at former third-party vendor Mixpanel.

Article Slug: soundcloud-and-pornhub-disclose-user-data-breaches

Published Date: Tue, 16 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 16 Dec 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 18 Dec 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →
